weeks.title: Early Development
weeks.development: The fertilized egg implants in the uterine wall. The amniotic sac and placenta begin to form.
tips: Start taking prenatal vitamins with folic acid (Folvite)
Schedule your first prenatal appointment with a Gynecologist
In India, traditional elders might advise against travel during this time

weeks.title: Heart Formation
weeks.development: The neural tube develops and the heart begins to beat. Early brain and spinal cord are forming.
tips: Stay hydrated - Coconut water / Nimbu pani are excellent options
Eat small, frequent meals (try roasted chana or murmura) to manage nausea

weeks.title: Facial Features Begin
weeks.development: Facial features like eyes and ears start forming. Arm and leg buds appear.
symptoms: Food aversions (often to strong spices/tadka smells)
tips: Get plenty of rest
Avoid raw or undercooked foods
Ginger tea (Adrak chai) can help soothe morning sickness

weeks.title: Moving Limbs
weeks.development: Fingers and toes are forming. Baby starts making small movements.
tips: Wear loose, comfortable cotton clothing (Kurtas are great)
Consider lemon/ginger pickle (in moderation) for nausea relief

weeks.title: Vital Organs Develop
weeks.development: All vital organs have begun to form. Bones start to harden.
tips: Discuss genetic testing options (Double marker test) with your doctor

weeks.title: End of First Trimester
weeks.development: Reflexes develop. Baby can open and close fingers. Nail beds form.
tips: Consider announcing your pregnancy to family
Nuchal Translucency (NT) scan is usually done between 11-13 weeks

weeks.title: Second Trimester Begins
weeks.development: Baby can make facial expressions. Hair follicles develop.
tips: Enjoy the 'honeymoon phase' of pregnancy
Include iron-rich foods like spinach (palak), jaggery (gud), and dates

weeks.title: Gender May Be Visible
weeks.development: Muscles strengthen. Baby can grasp with hands. Gender is NOT revealed in India (PNDT Act prohibits sex determination).
tips: Strictly remember: Sex determination is illegal in India
Sleep on your side

weeks.title: Hearing Develops
weeks.development: Baby can hear sounds. Vernix (protective coating) covers skin.
tips: Play music or talk to your baby (Garbh Sanskar)
Stretch before bed to prevent cramps

weeks.title: Halfway Point
weeks.development: Eyebrows and eyelids form. Baby is very active.
tips: Anatomy scan (Level 2 Ultrasound) is mandatory now
Practice good posture
Tetanus Toxoid (TT) injections are standard in India - check with doctor

weeks.title: Viable Outside Womb
weeks.development: Lungs develop surfactant. Baby reaches viability milestone.
tips: Monitor kicks daily
Use coconut oil or moisturizer for stretch marks

weeks.title: Third Trimester Begins
weeks.development: Baby can blink eyes. Brain development accelerates. May dream during REM sleep.
tips: Prenatal visits become more frequent (every 2 weeks)
Traditional 'Godh Bharai' (Baby Shower) is often planned around the 7th month

weeks.title: Preparing for Birth
weeks.development: Baby practices breathing. Fat accumulates for temperature regulation.
tips: Pack your hospital bag (include loose gowns/maxis)
Ensure your Mother and Child Protection (MCP) card is up to date

weeks.title: Almost Full Term
weeks.development: Baby may drop into pelvis. Lungs nearly mature.
tips: Weekly prenatal visits begin
Arrange transport for the hospital beforehand

weeks.title: Full Term
weeks.development: Baby is considered full term. Organs fully developed.
tips: Rest as much as possible
Discuss post-delivery care (Jaapa/Confinement) plans with elders

weeks.title: Due Date
weeks.development: Baby is ready for birth. Average newborn is 2.5-3.5 kg.
tips: Stay calm and relaxed
Contact your provider if contractions start

trimesters.title: First Trimester
trimesters.overview: The first trimester is a time of rapid development. Your baby's major organs and systems begin to form. Many Indian women rely on home cooked meals and family support during this time.

trimesters.title: Second Trimester
trimesters.overview: Often called the 'honeymoon phase,' many people feel their best during the second trimester. In India, this is often when the news is shared with extended family.
selfCare: Stay active with prenatal yoga (if doctor approves)
Eat balanced meals with dal, green veggies, and dairy

trimesters.title: Third Trimester
trimesters.overview: The final stretch! Your baby gains weight. You may move to your maternal home for delivery (if following tradition).
selfCare: Pack hospital bag with baby essentials
